property.name: nifi.version
property.description: The version number of the current release.

property.name: nifi.security.user.oidc.additional.scopes
property.description: Comma separated scopes that are sent to OpenId Connect Provider in addition to openid and email

property.name: nifi.security.user.oidc.claim.identifying.userv
property.description: Claim that identifies the user to be logged in; default is email. May need to be requested via the nifi.security.user.oidc.additional.scopes before usage. by the OpenId Connect Provider according to the specification. If this value is HS256, HS384, or HS512, NiFi will attempt to validate HMAC protected tokens using the specified client secret. If this value is none, NiFi will attempt to validate unsecured/plain tokens. Other values for this algorithm will attempt to parse as an RSA or EC algorithm to be used in conjunction with the JSON Web Key (JWK) provided through the jwks_uri in the metadata found at the discovery URL.

property.name: nifi.analytics.predict.enabled
property.description: This indicates whether prediction should be enabled for the cluster.

property.name: nifi.analytics.predict.interval
property.description: This indicates a time interval for which analytical predictions (queue saturation, e.g.) should be made.

property.name: nifi.analytics.connection.model.implementation
property.description: This is the implementation class for the status analytics model used to make connection predictions.

property.name: nifi.analytics.connection.model.score.name
property.description: This is the name of the scoring type that should be used to evaluate model.

property.name: nifi.analytics.connection.model.score.threshold
property.description: This is the threshold for the scoring value (where model score should be above given threshold).

property.name: nifi.analytics.query.interval
property.description: The time interval to query for past observations (e.g. the last 3 minutes of snapshots). The default value is 5 mins. NOTE: This value should be at least 3 times greater than nifi.components.status.snapshot.frequency to ensure enough observations are retrieved for predictions.

property.name: nifi.provenance.repository.implementation
property.description: The Provenance Repository implementation. The default value is org.apache.nifi.provenance.WriteAheadProvenanceRepository and should not be changed.

property.name: nifi.provenance.repository.max.storage.time
property.description: The maximum amount of time to keep data provenance information. The default value is 30 days.

property.name: nifi.provenance.repository.max.storage.size
property.description: The maximum amount of data provenance information to store at a time. The default is 10 GB.

property.name: nifi.provenance.repository.rollover.time
property.description: The amount of time to wait before rolling over the latest data provenance information so that it is available in the User Interface. The default value is 10 mins.
